    Features & Design

    With Windows 8.1 - for a smooth, versatile PC experience. Also available with Windows 7 Home Premium.
    Return to Top
    Fast, seamless performance
    Own the fastest XPS mini tower ever (16.01” high). With 4th Gen Intel® Core™ processors that perform 15% better than the previous generation, you can blaze through system-intensive applications like video editing, HD video playback, serious multitasking and extreme gaming.
    Return to Top
    Ample storage and expandability
    Opt for 2TB hard-drive storage and keep an impressive digital media library —around half a million photos or songs, 240 hours of video or 550 movies. And if even that’s not enough, you have the ability to expand to 4TB.

    The more memory, the better. At any time, installing more memory is a simple operation. Choose up to 16GB RAM now, with room for additional 16GB RAM when you're ready.​
    Return to Top
    More ports, faster connections
    Connect super fast with your six USB 3.0 ports, which can transfer data at speeds up to ten times faster than USB 2.0.

    Hook up HD displays and stream content to an HDTV using your HDMI port.

    19-in-1 media card reader     lets you upload photos, videos and more without wires.

    Sync Bluetooth devices and connect to the internet with Dell Wireless-N 1703 card.
    Return to Top
    Advanced graphics and sound
    Even better gaming and video editing
    Opt for NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 660 graphics for smooth, sharp images and movement that won’t slow you down.

    Studio-quality sound

    Your content. Anywhere, anytime.
    Retrieve that document you forgot to take to the meeting. Edit a photo and share it with friends. Collaborate on a project. Show a video. With PocketCloud or Dropbox, you can easily access all of your content anywhere on any device.

    PocketCloud
    Whether you want to edit and share a favorite photo, watch a movie, or access an important file from home, get whatever you need from your PC using your smartphone, tablet or other device. With PocketCloud, your applications and files are always at your fingertips, making it easy to be productive on the go. Safe, efficient and seamlessly integrated with your PC, it’s a great way to keep your desktop accessible wherever you are.

    Dropbox
    Dropbox is a service that lets you bring all your photos, docs, and videos anywhere, and share them easily. Access any file you save to your Dropbox from all of your computers, phones or tablets, and even the Dropbox website. Use Dropbox to save and share photos, videos, and your work in a snap. If something happens to any of your devices, your stuff is always safe in Dropbox. Get 20GB of Dropbox space included for a year with your purchase of a new Dell PC*.

    No matter which option you choose, rest assured that the content you care about is safely stored in the cloud.

    *Dell consumer PC or Venue tablet.

    Title: Really Great Computer
    PostedNovember 20, 2013
    Yes, I would recommend this product
    I bought the XPS 8700 with 32 gigs of ram, 3 TB hard drive and 256 gigs SSD and a nvida GeForce GT660 with 1.5 gig of memory. So far everything has been running great.     I bought the XPS 8700 with 32 gigs of ram, 3 TB hard drive and 256 gigs SSD and a nvida GeForce GT660 with 1.5 gig of memory. So far everything has been running great. It came with windows 8 and I was really hesitant to buy because of that but after a few days I got really comfortable with it. I upgraded to windows 8.1 and it still runs great. There have been a few things that have not run very good on it but that because they are older programs that are not updated for window 8. The computer boots up really fast and is ready to run. I still use the desktop for most thing but also use Metro too. You just have to do a little research before you start. So far I have been really happy with the computer. I would recommend this computer to any one. I bought this from the outlet with 30% off so it was really a good bargain.(hide)
    +9points

    Title: XPS 8700
    PostedNovember 22, 2013
    Yes, I would recommend this product
    First off I am very impressed with how quickly I received my new desktop, that means a lot to me. This review is on the configuration with 8GB ram 1TB hard drive and Nvidia GT350 video card. This system was intended to replace a low end laptop from 2009 and be used mostly for photo editing with Lightroom and Photoshop. When editing, time is money, and waiting up to 30 minutes to import or export photos was not acceptable. I would say from the work done so far that it's about 4 times faster than...(read more)
    First off I am very impressed with how quickly I received my new desktop, that means a lot to me. This review is on the configuration with 8GB ram 1TB hard drive and Nvidia GT350 video card. This system was intended to replace a low end laptop from 2009 and be used mostly for photo editing with Lightroom and Photoshop. When editing, time is money, and waiting up to 30 minutes to import or export photos was not acceptable. I would say from the work done so far that it's about 4 times faster than my old laptop. There are few things that could improve the performance like an SSD (which I plan to upgrade to soon) or a better video card, but for the price point you cant beat the XPS 8700. Soon after I set everything up I downloaded and installed Windows 8.1. I had a problem with it hanging up once and a while when sleeping or waking, but installing the recommended driver updates from Dell support cured the Issue. Overall I am extremely happy with my purchase I give the XPS 8700 5 stars for great performance and value.(hide)
    Pros:performance
    Cons:dated video card
    +7points

    Answers

    Answer: 
    I opted for the Windows 7 version (it was a $50 option on my XPS 8700) and I am so happy I did. I have a computer background and I not happy with the dumbed down operating systems that microsoft is heading towards. Windows 7 is actually quite good. It has enough of what will later be Windows 8 that you can see it coming, you have apps you choose. But its been said before and I will say it again, this is a Desktop, not a Tablet, and as such it calls for a real operating system and not Windows 8. Windows 7 is very nice, much more stable than previous Windows versions, you can 'tinker' as much as you want but it is definitely much smoother, user friendly interface. And if you ever want to go to Windows 8, its a very easy upgrade.

    Answers

    Answer: 
    Nope. But 7.1 audio out means a whole mess of 1/8" jacks on the back. Usually the built-in amplification is good and you can connect as few as 2 (Front L&R) and as many as 7, plus sub-woofer, I think. I usually just plug into the "Front" jack (L&R on same jack) and run it to a separate amp for better, easier tone, balance, etc. Not sure how extensive the adjustments on internal audio controls are, yet.. my 8700 arrives next week. (Unlike most people, I actually carefully read the information DELL puts on the listings)

    Answer: 
    Hello Bob,

    Thank you for your question. As it turns out, the XPS 8700 does not come standard with speakers. The back of the system does have the ports to support 7.1 channel audio speakers. If you want to add speakers to your purchase, you can find some here: http://dell.to/1cFDiTb. You can add a set to your cart to purchase with your system.

    I hope this helps. Have a great day.

    If I purchase the xps 8700 with 8GB of RAM, would it be possible to upgrade it later on to 16gb or 32gb?

    Report inappropriate content

    Answers

    Answer: 
    I believe I saw somewhere on the site that the 8700 can handle up to 64GB RAM in four (4) DIMM RAM sockets. Depending upon how DELL sets up the unit it sends you, it's possible all four sockets are used, each with a 2GB RAM module. That means to upgrade you need to decide what to do. Not sure, but maybe RAM modules need to be installed in pairs, so you can leave two modules of 2GB each and then put pairs of 4GB, 8GB or 16GB RAM modules in the other two RAM sockets. My 8700 will arrive next week (with 12GB RAM), so can probably answer the "in pairs?" question if I revisit here. You might try searching the site for more immediate answers in the technical/upgrade sections. Sorry, I don't have the time to look right now.

    Answer: 
    Yes. There are 4 slots for RAM, supporting up to 32 GB.

    If you buy it with 8 GB of RAM, it will come with 4 GB in each of 2 of the slots, leaving 2 empty slots in which you later could install more RAM.

    • Staff

    Answer: 
    Hello,

    Thank you for your interest in the XPS 8700! While it is certainly possible that we have sold these systems without a Wi-Fi adapter installed, all of the current configurations come with Wireless-N connectivity. You can make sure the configuration you want comes with Wireless-N connectivity by looking scrolling down the "View Details" list for the Wireless section. The current builds all come with the Dell Wireless 1703 802.11a/b/g/n, Bluetooth v4.0 adapter.
    Naturally, you can purchase and use your own wireless PCI Express card if you wish, instead of the built-in adapter that we provide. All XPS 8700 systems also come with a Gigabit (Ethernet 10/100/1000) port for secure, interference-free network connectivity.

    Hope this helps!
    JonathanNforDell

    Answer: 
    Hello JohnRossi,

    Thank you for your interest in the XPS 8700. The computer industry has done away with sending drivers and os backups on CD/DVDs. With the advent of digital downloads and online licensing, we are able to reduce landfill waste, and cut costs that we pass on to make systems more affordable. Dell also has a program that prompts you to make a backup restore copy in the initial setup. I recommend a thumb drive but, you can burn to CD/DVD if you like.

    Answer: 
    The specs do show this. Click on the 'View Details' link. There are 4 USB 2.0 (2 in back, 2 on top), 6 USB 3.0 (4 in back, 2 in front).

    Answer: 
    The XPS 8700 has 6 USB 3.0 slots (four in the back, two in the front) and 4 USB 2.0 slots (two in the back, two on the top).
    Plenty of connectivity!
